author: Elderry
body:
Steps to reproduce
---
- Open pwsh.exe

Expected behavior
---
- Console opened with correct icon.

Actual behavior
---------------
- Console opened with default icon.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1892221/47479462-de6d5500-d85f-11e8-98f6-59c7143b675c.png)
This images shows that native powershell has correct icon, while powershell core only shows default icon.

comments.author: Elderry
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT @thezim 
I figured out that it's my shortcut(lnk) file's problem. Here is the script I used to create shortcut:
```
$shortcut = $(New-Object -ComObject 'WScript.Shell').CreateShortcut($Path)
```
For PowerShell Core, I have to explicitly add this line
```
$shortcut.IconLocation = "$Target, 0"
```
to make console display the correct icon, while Native PowerShell doesn't have this problem.
I'm not sure if this has any thing related to PowerShell Core, if not, close this issue as you wish. Thank you for your help.

title: Console icon is missing.
